robotpy_toolkit_7407.sensors.color_sensor module¶

class robotpy_toolkit_7407.sensors.color_sensor.ColorSensor(sensor_port: int, I2C_address: int = 113, threshold_blue: float = 500, threshold_red: float = 500, threshold_green: float = 400, debug: bool = False)¶

Bases: object

REVColor Sensor Wrapper for usage with I2C Multiplexer

color() → str¶

Returns the color of the detected object.

Returns:

“red”, “blue”, or “none”.

Return type:

str

get_val() → tuple[float, float, float, int]¶

Return the raw values of the color sensor’s response.

Returns:

R, G, B, Proximity.

Return type:

tuple[float, float, float, int]

robotpy_toolkit_7407.sensors.limelight module¶

class robotpy_toolkit_7407.sensors.limelight.Limelight(cam_height: float, cam_angle: float, target_height: Optional[float] = None)¶

Bases: object

Wrapper for the Limelight sensor. Connect, get, and modify limelight values and settings through the NetworkTables interface.

calculate_distance() → float¶

Calculate distance of limelight from target. This function is not useful when the limelight and target are of similar height.

Returns:

Distance from target in meters

Return type:

float

get_x_offset() → float¶

Offset on the x plane from the target in radians

Returns:

Radian offset of the target from the center of the camera

Return type:

radians

led_off()¶

Turn limelight LEDs off. Recommended to use ref_off instead.

led_on()¶

Turn limelight LEDs on. Recommended to use ref_on instead.

ref_off()¶

Turn off the limelight LEDs and decrement the reference counter.

ref_on()¶

Turn on the limelight LEDs and increment the reference counter.

update()¶

Update Limelight Values to NetworkTables. Run this every loop to ensure fresh values.

robotpy_toolkit_7407.sensors.limit_switch module¶

class robotpy_toolkit_7407.sensors.limit_switch.LimitSwitch(port: int, inverted: bool = True)¶

Bases: object

Wrapper class for I2C Limit Switches

get_value()¶

Return if the limit switch is pressed or if object is detected (in the case of non-tactile sensors).

Returns:

True if pressed, False if not.

Return type:

bool

class robotpy_toolkit_7407.sensors.limit_switch.MagneticLimitSwitch(port: int, inverted: bool = True)¶

Bases: LimitSwitch

Wrapper class for I2C Magnetic Limit Switches
